CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Figure 8 shows that the J-V characteristics of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / TiO x / Al devices provide a similar trend to those of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al devices but their PCEs increased mainly due to increased short circuit currents.

Let's think step by step.

1. ITO: Indium Tin Oxide - a conductive oxide material commonly used as a transparent electrode in organic solar cells.
2. PEDOT: PSS: Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene): Poly(styrenesulfonate) - a conducting polymer used as a hole transporting material in organic solar cells.
3. Polymer: Unspecified organic material used as a component in the active layer of the organic solar cells.
4. PC71BM: 2,7-Polydiacetylene-C71-butyric acid methyl ester - a fullerene derivative used as an electron transporting material in organic solar cells.
5. TiOx: Titanium Oxide - a semiconducting oxide material used as a buffer layer and electron transporting material in organic solar cells.
6. Al: Aluminum - a metal used as a back contact in organic solar cells.
7. LiF: Lithium Fluoride - a compound used as a buffer and contact material in organic solar cells.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. ITO: Indium Tin Oxide
2. PEDOT: PSS: Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene): Poly(styrenesulfonate)
3. Polymer: (Unspecified organic material in the active layer)
4. PC71BM: 2,7-Polydiacetylene-C71-butyric acid methyl ester
5. TiOx: Titanium Oxide
6. Al: Aluminum

These are the entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to material names.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Indium Tin Oxide (ITO) |
| Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene): Poly(styrenesulfonate) (PEDOT:PSS) |
| Unspecified organic material (in the active layer) |
| 2,7-Polydiacetylene-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM) |
| Titanium Oxide (TiOx) |
| Aluminum (Al) |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Figure 8 shows that the J-V characteristics of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / TiO x / Al devices provide a similar trend to those of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al devices but their PCEs increased mainly due to increased short circuit currents.

Let's think step by step.

1. J-V characteristics: This refers to the current-voltage (I-V) characteristics of a device, which describes the relationship between the voltage applied to the device and the resulting current flowing through it.
2. ITO: Indium Tin Oxide, a conductive oxide material used as a transparent electrode in organic solar cells.
3. PEDOT : PSS: Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate), a conducting polymer used as a hole transport layer in organic solar cells.
4. polymer: An organic material used as an active layer in organic solar cells. In this context, it's not clear which specific polymer is being referred to.
5. PC71BM: A fullerene derivative, [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester, used as an electron transport layer in organic solar cells.
6. TiOx: Titanium oxide, a transparent conductive oxide used as a protective layer in organic solar cells.
7. Al: Aluminum, a metal used as a back contact in organic solar cells.
8. LiF: Lithium fluoride, a compound used as a buffer layer between the metal contact and the organic active layer in organic solar cells.
9. PCEs: Power conversion efficiencies, a measure of the efficiency of converting light energy into electrical energy in solar cells.
10. short circuit currents: The current flowing through a solar cell when the voltage is zero, which is a measure of the cell's ability to generate current.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. J-V characteristics
2. ITO
3. PEDOT : PSS
4. polymer (specific organic material used as an active layer is not mentioned, so it's not clear if it's relevant to the material properties)
5. PC71BM
6. TiOx
7. Al
8. PCEs (power conversion efficiencies)
9. short circuit currents (current flowing through a solar cell is a material property)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| J-V characteristics |
| ITO |
| PEDOT : PSS |
| polymer (specific organic material used as an active layer, if mentioned, should be included) |
| PC71BM |
| TiOx |
| Al |
| PCEs (power conversion efficiencies) |
| short circuit currents |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Figure 8 shows that the J-V characteristics of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / TiO x / Al devices provide a similar trend to those of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al devices but their PCEs increased mainly due to increased short circuit currents.

Let's think step by step.

1. ITO, PEDOT : PSS, polymer, PC71BM, TiO x, Al: These are the materials or components used in the fabrication of the devices. They can be considered as "Material" entities, but since they have specific properties that contribute to the device performance, they can also be considered as "Property Value" entities with the property being the type of material or component.
2. J-V characteristics: This refers to the current-voltage (I-V) characteristics of the devices. It is a graphical representation of the relationship between the voltage and current flowing through a device. It can be considered as a "Property Value" entity with the property being the electrical characteristics of the device.
3. PCEs: This stands for Power Conversion Efficiencies. It is a measure of the ability of a device to convert input energy into output energy. It is a "Property Value" entity with the property being the efficiency of the device.
4. Increased short circuit currents: This is a specific property or characteristic of the devices. It refers to the maximum current that can flow through the device when the voltage is zero. It is a "Property Value" entity with the property being the short circuit current.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. ITO, PEDOT : PSS, TiO x, Al: These are the materials or components used in the fabrication of the devices, and they have specific properties that contribute to the device performance. They can be considered as "Property Value" entities with the properties being the type of material or component and their electrical or optical properties that affect the device performance.
2. PCEs: This stands for Power Conversion Efficiencies. It is a measure of the ability of a device to convert input energy into output energy. It is a "Property Value" entity with the property being the efficiency of the device.
3. Increased short circuit currents: This is a specific property or characteristic of the devices that affects their electrical performance. It is a "Property Value" entity with the property being the short circuit current.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value                   |
|-------------------------------|
| ITO                          |
| PEDOT : PSS                  |
| Polymer                      |
| PC71BM                      |
| TiO x                       |
| Al                          |
| J-V characteristics         |
| Power Conversion Efficiencies (PCEs) |
| Increased short circuit currents |
